item.title: The Straussian take
item.description:
Michael P Gibson on Twitter

“V. much enjoyed Talent by @tylercowen & @danielgross Ostensibly the book offers tips for spotting talent. But the book is really about: Straussian take (1): the world is overwhelmingly made up of fakes and the robotic. Good luck Straussian (2): In fact you are fake and robotic”

URL: https://twitter.com/William_Blake/status/1527317608722182144

item.title: AGM interviews Daniel Gross and me on Talent and related matters, the semiotics of Zoom calls, plus a round of overrated vs. underrated, starting with Miami
item.description:
Antonio García Martínez (agm.eth) 🇺🇦 on Twitter

“The final cut of my interview with @tylercowen and @danielgross on their new book ‘Talent’ is out! The importance of your Zoom setting, how to (maybe) get hired by Tyler or Daniel, and most lastly, a round of “Overrated/Underrated?” with Tyler himself. https://t.co/i5nj5p9IMX”

URL: https://twitter.com/antoniogm/status/1527300411480084480

source: Thursday assorted links

item.title: Yann LeCun on AI risks
item.description:
Yann LeCun on Twitter

“About the raging debate regarding the significance of recent progress in AI, it may be useful to (re)state a few obvious facts: (0) there is no such thing as AGI. Reaching “Human Level AI” may be a useful goal, but even humans are specialized. 1/N”

item.title: It looks like we're headed for a soft landing
item.description:
A couple of weeks ago, I wrote a post envisioning a future where interest rates go to 8%. I made it clear that this was only a possible bad scenario that people should have contingency plans for, not a forecast that people should expect to come true. In fact, I think the most…

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/it-looks-like-were-headed-for-a-soft?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: No Housing Please, We're a Community
item.description:
I received a really interesting, insightful comment on a subscribers-only piece from a few weeks ago, on the tension between community and continuity on the one hand, and development and growth on the other. I had mentioned in passing the right-wing meme “I will not live in a pod,” which refers to the supposed notion that liberals want to cram everyone i…

URL: https://thedeletedscenes.substack.com/p/no-housing-thank-you-were-a-community?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web
